definition: imminent/just around the corner (idiom)
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to stay

sentences.english: A micro-biocide to help women protect themselves is likely just around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 一种有利于妇女自身保护的杀菌剂可能会指日可待。

sentences.english: It won't be long before Chinese mythology is reconstructed and systematised.
sentences.chinese: 重构中国神话的系统工作已经指日可待了。

sentences.english: And it will come not just easy, but also fast.
sentences.chinese: 它会来得容易且快速，并且指日可待。

sentences.english: Thus to strengthen the classical teaching in Senior High is in the process.
sentences.chinese: 那么高中文言文教学之新面目定能指日可待。

sentences.english: It has a 4-foot long flexible shaft for easy use and long reach.
sentences.chinese: 它有一个4英尺长的软轴易于使用和长期指日可待。

sentences.english: Domestic filing in the same nature is to be seen very soon. (On internet the first anti-monopoly case against the State Quality Supervision Bureau was reported).
sentences.chinese: 但国内同类案件的出现也是指日可待的。

definition: to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
worthy of celebration/gratifying/Congratulations!
hopeful/promising
to be definitely able (to do sth)
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
soon/shortly/on a day quite soon/promptly
near at hand/imminent/within sight
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
inevitably
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to have boundless prospects
to be nothing difficult/to be a cinch
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
far in the indefinite future (idiom); so far away it seems forever
circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
